fullText: Ms. Lynch gives what may be the performance of her career as Margaret Walsh, a struggling single mother from South Boston who refuses to let poverty strip her of her dignity or her wicked sense of humor.
dtliExcerpt: Ms. Lynch gives what may be the performance of her career as Margaret Walsh, a struggling single mother from South Boston who refuses to let poverty strip her of her dignity or her wicked sense of humor.
bwwExcerpt: Embodied with an ideal balance of expertise and empathy by Frances McDormand, Margie (as her friends call her, using a hard “g”) is the not-quite heroine of David Lindsay-Abaire’s “Good People,” the very fine new play that opened Thursday night at the Samuel J. Friedman Theater. And discovering how Margie operates — and where she’s coming from — is one of the more subtly surprising treats of this theater season.
